intro: Cyathea paulistana, commonly known as the São Paulo tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, trunk-like stem covered in persistent, fibrous roots. The plant has large, feather-like fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Cyathea paulistana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
